content: What do you all think of https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/issues/1041#issuecomment-770000544? We can discuss this in the meeting next week, but thought I'd bring it up now.

Eric Huss points out that this is how the Reference and Cargo docs do it:

That is how it is done with Cargo and the reference. It takes up a lot more space, but overall I think it works.
Having looked into mdbook's, mdbook-toc's, and pulldown-cmark-to-cmark's code, I really prefer this xD
Furthermore, I don't think a table scales much further if we keep adding to the glossary

We didn't get to talk much about it during the meeting, but I'm not sure there is much to be discussed about this.
I was planning on copying the layout from the reference: turn each row in the table into a 3rd level title.
and fix references to point to the correct links instead of the existing span id values
Hopefully the linkchecker will be able to help you catch any un-updated anchors.
